title: Futurist- COVID-19 Futures Support Team
description:
Background 
 Over the past year, the Data, Strategy and Innovation (DSI) Group has been working with Member States and countries to apply futures approaches to longer term health systems planning. Traditional planning generally strives to overcome problems and issues being faced at the time of planning and/or derived from experiences in the recent past. This retrospective approach can result in short-sighted responses that may not meet the challenges posed by a rapidly changing world with emerging environmental threats, political and demographic shifts and technological opportunities. By contrast, a strategic health futures dialogue is based on a prospective approach, by which a vision for the future is developed and policies and plans to achieve that vision are formed through backcasting.   
 This approach has been modified and coupled with an agile methodology to respond to the rapidly growing pandemic. Multidisciplinary teams tasked with looking at the future through a specific impact lens (e.g. NPIs, equity, economy) will be established: the teams will work over short sprints; describing future scenarios; and the impact on health systems and health status. Using a backcasting approach, the teams will then identify strategic actions for WHO and countries that future proof systems and responses, manage hyper change and build resilience. 
 Over the course of the pandemic, this approach will be applied and modified to give strategic advice to senior management within the WHO Regional Office for the Western Pacific as well as shape guidance for countries. 
   
 Purpose/Specific Objective of the Activity 
 To support the coordination of futures think tanks and explore a broad futures approach in delivering strategic insights for the Western Pacific Region on COVID-19 scenarios and their consequences over the next 18 months. The futures think tanks will drive thinking and strategy on ways to address the pandemic by building resilience among countries and governments and creating future-proof organizations and systems. 
   
 Method(s) to carry out the activity 
  
 Output 1:          Support to the WPRO think tanks   
  
 Deliverables 
 
 Provide support to the day to day running of the think tanks. 
 Trouble shooting and supporting the team to keep track of progress. 
 
   
 Output 2:          Development of the outputs for the think tanks 
  
 Deliverables 
 
 Creating stakeholder specific formats for the think tank team to provide feedback in. 
 Supporting each of the think tanks to create graphics and slide sets to guide strategic messaging. 
 Drafting short narratives that explain the outputs. 
 Working with external futurists to identify new ways of communicating the futures work to the general public. 
 
   
 Output 3:         Working with WHO staff and other contractors to develop a webpage to communicate the outputs of the think tanks and longer-term work of strategic health futures dialogue  
  
 Deliverables 
 
 Identify and format key content to be communicated including futures wheels, graphic content and key information to be shared. 
 Provide direction to the website developer on overall aesthetics. 
 Proactively seek feedback from end users. 
 Support the end-to-end process development for the webpage. 
 
   
 Output 4:         Support to developing and informing COVID-19 responses in the Western Pacific region using futures thinking and foresight methodologies 
 Deliverables 
 
 Ongoing support to COVID-19 discussions at Regional and country levels. 
 Supporting the translation of outputs and results of COVID-19 discussions into subject-specific formats. 
 
   
 Education/Qualifications 
University degree in medicine, business management or other relevant degree in social or natural sciences. 
Desirable: Master's degree or PhD in management, business administration, public health or related studies. 
 Experience 
At least five years’ experience strategic planning, training and workshop methodologies including some experience within an international context. Experience in programme implementation. 
 Technical skills and knowledge 
Excellent in report writing and data analysis. Good knowledge of the dynamics of the international public health work. Excellent people and communication skills (oral and written). Ability to work effectively and deliver outputs in a timely manner. 
 Languages 
Excellent knowledge of spoken and written English is essential. Working knowledge of other UN languages is an advantage 
 Competencies 
 
 Producing results 
 Communication 
 Moving forward in a changing environment 
 Fostering integration and teamwork 
 Respecting and promoting individual and cultural differences 
 
   
 Additional information: 
 WHO will review all the proposals and take the best proposal, based on the prevailing industry rates 
   
 Please submit following documents to the Supply Officer (WPRO) at  wproungm@who.int  by 15 May 2020. (Subject: Tender Notice 192009) 
____________________________________________________________________ 
 
 Expression of interest (cover letter)  
 Proposed fee and timelines 
 Portfolio and samples of work 
 WHO personal history form or CV 
 Please note that the application may be closed before the indicated closing date if a sufficient number of applications are received 
 Only the successful candidates will be contact

title: Lead Futurist- COVID-19 Futures Support Team
description:
Background 
 Over the past year, the Data, Strategy and Innovation (DSI) Group has been working with Member States and countries to apply futures approaches to longer term health systems planning. Traditional planning generally strives to overcome problems and issues being faced at the time of planning and/or derived from experiences in the recent past. This retrospective approach can result in short-sighted responses that may not meet the challenges posed by a rapidly changing world with emerging environmental threats, political and demographic shifts and technological opportunities. By contrast, a strategic health futures dialogue is based on a prospective approach, by which a vision for the future is developed and policies and plans to achieve that vision are formed through backcasting.   
 This approach has been modified and coupled with an agile methodology to respond to the rapidly growing pandemic. Multidisciplinary teams tasked with looking at the future through a specific impact lens (e.g. NPIs, equity, economy) will be established: the teams will work over short sprints; describing future scenarios; and the impact on health systems and health status. Using a backcasting approach, the teams will then identify strategic actions for WHO and countries that future proof systems and responses, manage hyper change and build resilience. 
 Over the course of the pandemic, this approach will be applied and modified to give strategic advice to senior management within the WHO Regional Office for the Western Pacific as well as shape guidance for countries. 
   
 Purpose/Specific Objective of the Activity 
 To support the coordination of futures think tanks and explore a broad futures approach in delivering strategic insights for the Western Pacific Region on COVID-19 scenarios and their consequences over the next 18 months. The futures think tanks will drive thinking and strategy on ways to address the pandemic by building resilience among countries and governments and creating future-proof organizations and systems. 
   
 Method(s) to carry out the activity 
  
 Output 1:          Ongoing support to the coordination of the WPRO think tank teams 
  
 Deliverables 
 
 Day-to-day oversight of the think tanks. 
 Identification of think tank topics. 
 Managing schedules for the teams. 
 Enrolment of new think tanks and think tank members. 
 Oversee the development of the different products from the think tank. 
 Coordinate feedback to various stakeholders. 
 
   
 Output 2:           Refinement of design and methodology in coordination with other consultants and WHO staff 
  
 Deliverables 
 
 Scoping, designing and framing the sprints process. 
 Review of the questions to ensure strong delivery of outcomes. 
 Advice on scenarios and implications and cross-sprint interaction to stimulate thinking. 
 
   
 Output 3:          Supporting the development of strategic partnerships in the Region 
  
 Deliverables 
 
 Identifying key stakeholders in the Region. 
 Maintaining regular communication with stakeholders and identifying opportunities for them to be involved in the think tank work. 
 Building the network of futurists to support the process and identifying opportunities to utilise them. 
 Ensuring network of futurists is captured and stored in an accessible, sustainable format. 
 
   
 Output 4:          Development of a Regional communication strategy for the futures work related to COVID-19 and beyond 
  
 Deliverables 
 
 Development of a short report describing the strategy (including situation and stakeholder analysis). 
 Identify new tools for communicating the outputs and process and oversee delivery. 
 Capture and incorporate ongoing feedback 
 
   
 Output 5:          Developing and informing COVID-19 responses in the Western Pacific Region using futures thinking and foresight methodologies 
  
 Deliverables 
 
 Ongoing support to COVID-19 discussions at regional and country levels. 
 Responsible for the translation of outputs and results from COVID-19 think tanks and discussions into subject-specific formats. 
 
   
 Education/Qualifications 
University degree in medicine, business management or other relevant degree in social or natural sciences. 
Desirable: Master's degree or PhD in management, business administration, public health or related studies. 
 . Experience 
At least seven years’ experience strategic planning, training and workshop methodologies including some experience within an international context. Experience in programme implementation, experience of foresight/ futures methodologies. 
 Technical skills and knowledge 
Excellent in report writing and data analysis. Good knowledge of the dynamics of the international public health work. Excellent people and communication skills (oral and written). Ability to work effectively and deliver outputs in a timely manner. 
 Languages 
Excellent knowledge of spoken and written English is essential. Working knowledge of other UN languages is an advantage 
 Competencies 
 
 Producing results 
 Communication 
 Moving forward in a changing environment 
 Fostering integration and teamwork 
 Respecting and promoting individual and cultural differences 
 
   
 Additional information: 
 WHO will review all the proposals and take the best proposal, based on the prevailing industry rates 
   
 Please submit following documents to the Supply Officer (WPRO) at  wproungm@who.int  by 15 May 2020. (Subject: Tender Notice 192008) 
____________________________________________________________________ 
 
 Expression of interest (cover letter)  
 Proposed fee and timelines 
 Portfolio and samples of work 
 WHO personal history form or CV 
 Please note that the application may be closed before the indicated closing date if a sufficient number of applications are received 
 Only the successful candidates will be contacted

 Scoping, designing and framing the sprints process. 
 Review of the questions to ensure strong delivery of outcomes. 
 Advice on scenarios and implications and cross-sprint interaction to stimulate thinking. 
 
   
 Output 3:          Supporting the development of strategic partnerships in the Region 
  
 Deliverables 
 
 Identifying key stakeholders in the Region. 
 Maintaining regular communication with stakeholders and identifying opportunities for them to be involved in the think tank work. 
 Building the network of futurists to support the process and identifying opportunities to utilise them. 
 Ensuring network of futurists is captured and stored in an accessible, sustainable format. 
 
   
 Output 4:          Development of a Regional communication strategy for the futures work related to COVID-19 and beyond 
  
 Deliverables 
 
 Development of a short report describing the strategy (including situation and stakeholder analysis). 
 Identify new tools for communicating the outputs and process and oversee delivery. 
 Capture and incorporate ongoing feedback 
 
   
 Output 5:          Developing and informing COVID-19 responses in the Western Pacific Region using futures thinking and foresight methodologies 
  
 Deliverables 
 
 Ongoing support to COVID-19 discussions at regional and country levels. 
 Responsible for the translation of outputs and results from COVID-19 think tanks and discussions into subject-specific formats. 
 
   
 Education/Qualifications 
University degree in medicine, business management or other relevant degree in social or natural sciences. 
Desirable: Master's degree or PhD in management, business administration, public health or related studies. 
 . Experience 
At least seven years’ experience strategic planning, training and workshop methodologies including some experience within an international context. Experience in programme implementation, experience of foresight/ futures methodologies. 
 Technical skills and knowledge 
Excellent in report writing and data analysis. Good knowledge of the dynamics of the international public health work. Excellent people and communication skills (oral and written). Ability to work effectively and deliver outputs in a timely manner. 
 Languages 
Excellent knowledge of spoken and written English is essential. Working knowledge of other UN languages is an advantage 
 Competencies 
 
 Producing results 
 Communication 
 Moving forward in a changing environment 
 Fostering integration and teamwork 
 Respecting and promoting individual and cultural differences 
 
   
 Additional information: 
 WHO will review all the proposals and take the best proposal, based on the prevailing industry rates 
   
 Please submit following documents to the Supply Officer (WPRO) at  wproungm@who.int  by 15 May 2020. (Subject: Tender Notice 192008) 
____________________________________________________________________ 
 
 Expression of interest (cover letter)  
 Proposed fee and timelines 
 Portfolio and samples of work 
 WHO personal history form or CV 
 Please note that the application may be closed before the indicated closing date if a sufficient number of applications are received

title: Communications - COVID-19 Innovation Team
description:
Background 
 The COVID-19 pandemic has unleashed an unprecedented wave of creativity and collaboration. This wave of innovation – and the potential lessons being learned – risk being lost to history if there is no systematic approach or effort to capture what was done, and what is still being done. Despite the ever-increasing wealth of information regarding innovative products, services, approaches, and policies, evidence (and its translation into action) is still lacking given that many efforts are unprecedented, untested, iterative, and implemented in ways that prioritize practicality over scientific integrity. 
 Furthermore, many such innovations are inevitably context-dependent, at different levels of maturity, and pose challenges surrounding privacy and civil liberties. Research efforts must therefore be carefully crafted in order to produce the right kinds of knowledge asset for the right kind of stakeholder. The curation of such knowledge and its translation into relevant innovative solutions would better support Member States in identifying and adopting new options to address and inform strategic priorities. 
   
 Purpose/Specific Objective of the Activity 
 To ensure innovations being deployed as part of country response are collected and collated to inform country prioritization, strategic research priorities and innovation agendas, and provide options for future preparedness, surveillance, and response. 
   
 Method(s) to carry out the activity 
  
 Output 1:          Communications 
 
Deliverables 
 
 Responsible for working closely with communications team to promote work of team and ensure use of social media to engage general public and partners (Twitter, Facebook, podcasts, website, etc). 
 Development of innovation related products (e.g. guidelines resulting from information generated in the COVID-19 inventory). 
 Responsible for writing briefs for senior management related to innovation. 
 Support development of an interactive report detailing research gaps and priorities for COVID-19 innovations.  
 Establish and implement a communications strategy and workplan to update stakeholders, including internal WHO staff on the progress of the projects. 
 Support and efficiently manage agreed-upon communication mechanisms with the WPRO research groups and all other stakeholders with regards to updates on innovations 
 
   
 Output 2:          Project management 
  
 Deliverables 
 
 Project management for all activities within the innovation program in general and COVID-19 inventory specifically. 
 Responsible for supporting the feedback loop during and post review of innovations to ensure all innovation submissions receive adequate responses. 
 Review and manage budget. 
 Responsible for all administrative aspects of innovation team, including development of terms of reference and APWs for platform development.  
 Ongoing support to Member States and countries across the Western Pacific Region on COVID-19 innovations communications and outreach. 
 
   
 Education/Qualifications 
University degree in communication, business management or other relevant degree. 
Desirable: Master's degree in business management, communication or other relevant degree. 
 Experience 
At least five years’ experience in positions in public health and/or health research including some experience within an international context. Experience in business training/strategy/business development. Experience in use of social media (content development, posting, listening, handling campaigns/advocacy presence). 
 Technical skills and knowledge 
Excellent people and communication skills (oral and written). Strong management and coordination skills. Good knowledge of the dynamics of the international public health work. Ability to work effectively and deliver outputs ina timely manner. 
 Languages 
Excellent knowledge of spoken and written English is essential. Working knowledge of other UN languages is an advantage 
 Competencies 
 
 Producing results 
 Communication 
 Moving forward in a changing environment 
 Fostering integration and teamwork 
 Respecting and promoting individual and cultural differences 
 
   
 Additional information: 
 WHO will review all the proposals and take the best proposal, based on the prevailing industry rates 
 
 
   
 Please submit following documents to the Supply Officer (WPRO) at wproungm@who.int  by 15 May 2020. (Subject: Tender Notice 192007) 
____________________________________________________________________ 
 
 Expression of interest (cover letter)  
 Proposed fee and timelines 
 Portfolio and samples of work 
 WHO personal history form or CV 
 Please note that the application may be closed before the indicated closing date if a sufficient number of applications are received 
 Only the successful candidates will be contacted

title: ITB-163-20 Cash for Work for Rubble Removal, Curbstone Painting and Desks Repairing in Hamam Alil & Al Shoura-Ninawa Governorate
description:
The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) hereby invites you to submit a Bid to this Invitation to   Bid (ITB) for the above-referenced subject. 
   
 This ITB includes the following documents and the General Terms and Conditions of Contract which is inserted in the Bid Data Sheet: 
                 Section 1: This Letter of Invitation 
 Section 2: Instruction to Bidders 
 Section 3: Bid Data Sheet (BDS)        
 Section 4: Evaluation Criteria 
 Section 5: Schedule of Requirements and Technical Specifications 
 Section 6: Returnable Bidding Forms 
 
 Form A: Bid Submission Form 
 Form B: Bidder Information Form 
 Form C: Joint Venture/Consortium/Association Information Form 
 Form D: Qualification Form 
 Form E: Format of Technical Bid 
 Form F: Price Schedule                
 Form G: Form of Bid Security 
 Form G.1: Template for Bid Security Confirmation 
 Form H:    Performance Security 
 
 Annex A – Drawings (attached separately) 
 Annex B – BOQ in Excel (attached separately) 
 Annex C – Technical compliance sheet (attached separately) 
 Annex D – Technical specifications of electrical materials (attached separately) 
 Appendix 1 - Instructions manual for use of the e-Tendering system by suppliers (attached separately) 
   
 If you are interested in submitting a Bid in response to this ITB, please prepare your Bid in accordance with the requirements and procedure as set out in this ITB and submit it by the Deadline for Submission of Bids set out in Bid Data Sheet. 
   
 In case your company is not registered in the E-Tendering Module, please use the following temporary username and password to register your company/firm: 
 Username: event.guest 
 Password: why2change 
   
 Bidders, who registered on the e-tendering, will be able to download the complete bidding documents from the e-tendering website at:  https://etendering.partneragencies.org 
   
 The bidder/s is requested to confirm in their bids that they have visited and examined the site and its surroundings, and obtained for themselves, on their own responsibility, all information which may be necessary for preparing the tender/bid and entering into a contract. 
   
 The Procurement notice includes the details of the UNDP focal person and the email provided is YAHOO account as per following details: 
   
 Focal person: Muhammad Ibraheem Gasmy 
 Email address: gasmyy_85k@gmail.com 
 Mobile number: +964 750 5997357 
   
   
 If you need further information, please feel free to contact the following: 
 Focal Person in UNDP: Ahmad Sleiman, Procurement Analyst 
 Address: UNDP, Iraq                                                                                                                          
 E-mail address: ahmad.sleiman@undp.org 
   
   
 You may acknowledge receipt of this ITB utilize the “Accept Invitation” function in eTendering system, where applicable. This will enable you to receive amendments or updates to the ITB. Should you require further clarifications, kindly communicate with the contact person/s identified in the attached Data Sheet as the focal point for queries on this ITB.  
   
 UNDP looks forward to receiving your Bid and thank you in advance for your interest in UNDP procurement opportunities.

title: BES-Net Comm & Outreach Technical Support Officer
description: The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) is currently implementing a project Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services Network (BES-Net) project that requires the services of an individual to support in managing all aspects related to the online communication and outreach activities of BES-Net as described in the above mentioned subject. In consideration of your qualifications, we are hereby inviting you to submit an offer for this particular assignment. To assist you in understanding the requirements of this assignment, we have attached hereto the following : a) The Terms of Reference for the assignment described above; b) The standard Letter of Confirmation of Interest and Availability, which you must accomplish and submit to UNDP; and c) The Individual Contract and its General Terms and Conditions, which you would be expected to sign in the event you are the selected Offeror in this procurement process. This process is managed through the UNDP online eTendering system: https://etendering.partneragencies.org. Should you be interested and decide to submit an offer for this assignment, kindly send them no later than Thursday 24th October 2019 at 11:59 pm Kenyan time. Detailed user guide on how to register in the system and submit the proposal are attached to this notice. If you decide not to submit an offer, we would appreciate if you would advise us accordingly, preferably indicating the reasons for declining this invitation. In the meantime, we look forward to your favorable response, and thank you in advance for your interest in working with UNDP. Sincerely, UNDP Kenya Procurement Unit

title: Two Fluorescence-assisted Cell Sorters
description:
The DTU Department of Biotechnology and Biomedicine wants to buy two fluorescence-assisted cell sorter (FACS) instruments. The two FACS instruments will be platform instrumentation in two different facilities at the department. The two facilities are closely collaborating, require the same instrument specifications, and may have overlapping users, thus the potential to compare results between the two instruments is important.
The DTU Department of Biotechnology and Biomedicine wants to buy two fluorescence-assisted cell sorter (FACS) instruments. The two FACS instruments will be platform instrumentation in two different facilities at the department. The two facilities are closely collaborating, require the same instrument specifications, and may have overlapping users, thus the potential to compare results between the two instruments is important.The cell sorters will be used for multiple purposes including, but not limited to, single cell analysis (e.g., proteomics and transcriptomics), mammalian cell engineering for cell line- and production clone development, and isolation of cell subpopulations (both bacteria and mammalian cells) for down-stream assays incl. immune cell functionality. Therefore, we need a very versatile instrument with respect to optical specifications that allow detection of both fluorescent proteins as well as identification and isolation of cellular subpopulations using standard panels of fluorescently conjugated antibodies and functionality dyes. The potential to sort single cells at high velocity into 348 well plates is of high importance as is the ability to sort under aseptic conditions and to prevent cross-contamination be-tween samples/users. The instrument will be operated by multiple users from different academic levels and therefore automatic setup, calibration, and QC as well as ease-of-use and wizard-guided procedures is of high importance. The instruments will also be used as a service facility for fee-based analyses and sortings for users outside of the department.

title: SMS, Communication Services for Employees and Central Internet Communication
description:
The aim of the procurement is to try to gather services within SMS, communication services for employees and central internet communication that can be covered by one or several tenderers. Norsk Tipping currently has separate contracts, but would like to gather one or several of the contracts if appropriate. The communication services are necessary for ensuring that Norsk Tipping's employees have communication systems and tools to communicate with customers and provide gaming products.
The aim of the procurement is to try to gather services within SMS, communication services for employees and central internet reception that can be covered by one or several tenderers. Norsk Tipping currently has separate contracts, but would like to gather one or several of the contracts if appropriate. The communication services are necessary for ensuring that Norsk Tipping's employees have communication systems and tools to communicate with customers and provide gaming products.Subarea 1 SMS servicesNorsk Tipping expects, in line with the digital commitment and developments in recent years, that the amount of mobile communication will increase, at the same time as it becomes more nuanced and adapted to each customer to a greater and greater degree. Norsk Tipping is looking for to make its mobile communication with customers cost efficient, hence we are looking to move customer services from SMS to push notifications. The message services will still be expected to be free of charge for the company's customers, without there being any guarantee for this.Subarea 2 communication services for employeesElectronic forms of communication with the company's customers and employees play a central role in Norsk Tipping's digital commitment, this brings about the need for this procurement. The company's existing contract in this area with Telenor expires on 31 December 2020. It will be replaced by a new contract. It is important that tenderers have overall liability for the system.Subarea 3 push notificationsNorsk Tipping currently offers push notifications for ‘one-to many’ notifications such as prize drawing notifications, campaigns and scoring notifications. More personalised notifications are mainly sent by SMS and telephone. Norsk Tipping would like to move more of this over to push notifications and in general be able to offer more personalised push notifications. Norsk Tipping would like a system that handles the registration of mobile units for push notifications, as well as integration and dispatches to the different platform specific push services. The system must forward notifications from different services as push notifications to users of Norsk Tipping's applications. This will first be on Android and iOS and preferably also on the web.Subarea 4 central internet communication (SIK)Norsk Tipping intends to enter into a contract with a tenderer for the delivery of high performance internet communication and services for ensuring this. Norsk Tipping currently has high performance internet communication from both Telia and Telenor. The contract with Telenor will expire in the summer and a new contest must therefore be held. The communication is currently provided as Internet transit on fibre with close to 100 % running time. Norsk Tipping AS (AS202230) currently has a status as a LIR (Local Internet registry) and has separate official addresses for both IPv4 and IPv6. The need that must be met is the provision of internet transit communication with close to 100 % running time. In particular the capacity in the entire delivery chain is important. Security services are also important to guarantee running time and capacity.

title: 19-00309 Framework Agreement for Long-haul Transport
description: ROAF needs to enter into parallel framework agreements for long-haul transport. The contracting authority sorts different fractions in their post-sorting plant (ESAR) at Skedsmo Miljøpark at Berger in Lillestrøm Municipality. The waste is transported to different countries in Europe and exported on Annex VII, which is the green-listed waste. In 2019, 3 500 tonne of plastic was freighted from ESAR to Germany, the Netherlands and Lithuania. The plastic is baled in about 1 m3 large bales with an individual weight of 500 kg-800 kg per ball. The contracting authority loads the vehicle, the recipient is responsible for unloading on arrival. Documentation (weight note Commercial Invoice, Annex VII) is sent with the transport. The supplier is responsible for customs at border crossings, all the way to the recipient.

In 2019, 3 500 tonne of plastic was freighted from ESAR to Germany, the Netherlands and Lithuania. The plastic is baled in about 1 m3 large bales with an individual weight of 500 kg-800 kg per ball. The contracting authority loads the vehicle, the recipient is responsible for unloading on arrival. Documentation (weight note Commercial Invoice, Annex VII) is sent with the transport. The supplier is responsible for customs at border crossings, all the way to the recipient.", "tenderPeriod": {"endDate": "2020-05-19T00:00:00+00:00"}, "contractPeriod": {"durationInDays": 732}, "awardCriteriaDetails": "The most economic tender"}, "language": "en", "planning": {"budget": {"amount": {"amount": 6800000.0, "currency": "NOK"}}}, "initiationType": "tender"}], "publisher": {"uid": "https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733", "uri": "https://openopps.com", "name": "Open Opps", "scheme": "Companies House"}, "extensions": ["https://raw.githubusercontent.com/open-contracting/ocds_process_title_extension/v1.1.3/extension.json"], "publishedDate": "2020-04-16T09:30:55.684104+00:00", "publicationPolicy": "https://openopps.com/legal/"}

title: Open Tender Competition for the Purchase of a Project Manager — Sophies Minde
description:
Oslo Kommune c/o Omsorgsbygg Oslo KF [Oslo Municipality c/o the Municipal Undertaking for Social Service Buildings], hereafter called the contracting authority, invites tenderers to participate in an open tender competition in connection with the procurement of a Project manager — Sophies Minde. The purpose of the procurement is to cover the need for project management during the rehabilitation of Sophies Minde. The assignment is described in detail in Appendix 1, Service description.

title: Deliver STEYR Engine Support to Maintain the Capability of MoD Boats
description:
This framework agreement is to provide in-service support, including repair, service, supply and PDS to the STEYR inboard engines which support the fleet, thus providing capability to the user community. All work will be authorised on a task by task basis.
The Boats team is responsible for maintaining world wide delivery of safe, capable and available craft to a diverse user community, which includes the Offshore Riding Craft (ORCS) to which STEYR engines are fitted and operated by the Royal Marines. This enables them to carry out their endorsed tasking in roles relating to maritime operations, responsive force, adaptive force, extended readiness and training.This contract is to provide in-service support, including supply, to the STEYR inboard engines which support that fleet, thus providing capability to the user community. This contract is a framework agreement and all work will be authorised on a task by task basis and will include but not be limited to:(i) transportation of engines between the boat's location (both inside and outside the UK) and the contractor's premises;(ii) strip, survey and quotation;(iii) service and overhaul;(iv) rebuild;(v) disposal;(vi) supply of spares.No business whatsoever is guaranteed under any resulting framework agreement indeed there is no guarantee that any framework agreement will be put in place in relation to this notice. No compensation etc. will be paid if a tender or resulting framework agreement is withdrawn for any reason. Bidders should take part in this process only on the basis that they fully understand and accept this position.

title: Northamptonshire County Council Passenger Transport Services DPS
description:
Northamptonshire County Council (the ‘Authority’) wishes to invite tenders for the supply of services in respect of Passenger Transport Services. This Dynamc Purchasing System (DPS) will commence on 8 June 2020 and is for a period of 4 years.
This Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) is for delivery of passenger transport services; these will be for arrange of client groups including pupils (to/from mainstream and special educational needs establishments), social service users. These services will be for Northamptonshire County Council only. DPS will commence on the notified date and will be live for a maximum of 4 years if not extended.

DPS will commence on the notified date and will be live for a maximum of 4 years if not extended.", "tenderPeriod": {"endDate": "2026-04-24T00:00:00+00:00"}, "contractPeriod": {"durationInDays": 1464}, "awardCriteriaDetails": "The most economic tender"}, "language": "en", "planning": {"budget": {"amount": {"amount": 120000000.0, "currency": "GBP"}}}, "initiationType": "tender"}], "publisher": {"uid": "https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/04962733", "uri": "https://openopps.com", "name": "Open Opps", "scheme": "Companies House"}, "extensions": ["https://raw.githubusercontent.com/open-contracting/ocds_process_title_extension/v1.1.3/extension.json"], "publishedDate": "2020-04-28T09:35:48.913367+00:00", "publicationPolicy": "https://openopps.com/legal/"}

title: Architectural and Related Professional Services Framework — New Build Housing and Urban Design
description:
New Gorbals Housing Association are looking to appoint suitably qualified and experienced suppliers to their architectural and related professional services framework.It is intended that the initial framework agreement shall be for a period of 3 years with the option to extend for a further 12 months. During this period New Gorbals Housing Association shall be entitled to call-off services from the framework agreement on a project by project basis. It is estimated that the value of the services to be called-off over the four year period will be circa GBP 2 200 000 to GBP 2 800 000.
This procurement exercise relates to the procurement of a multi supplier framework agreement architectural and related consultancy services in various specialist areas. The authority intends to appoint up to 7 suppliers to the framework agreement.The provision of architectural consultancy services associated with the design and construction of new build housing including, but not limited to, the following areas:— design and documentation services compatible with the RIBA plan of work 2020 – production of architectural drawings, engineering drawings, design drawings;— contract administration services.The procurement also requires the provision by the consultant of engineering consultancy services (sub contracted as necessary) as required to complete the design of new build housing, specifically in the following disciplines:— structural engineers,— civil engineers.The consultant will also have the capability and capacity to fulfil the roles of contract administrator and principal designer in order to plan, manage, monitor and coordinate the pre-construction phase. This includes managing and mitigating any potential health and safety risks throughout the design process. Further services as mutually agreed between contracting authority and consultant will be required.

title: Card Acquiring
description:
Card acquiring servicesThe University of Winchester is tendering for the provision of merchant services for processing, authorisation and settlement of the University’s debit and credit transactions via all payment channels including customer present (Chip and PIN/contactless payments), customer not present (mail order/telephone order) and online (e-commerce). Winchester is looking to develop efficient and cost-effective merchant service arrangements which will be able to meet future market and technological changes. Ideally, we will be looking for a partner to add value through a dedicated support team backed up by a proactive education sector specialist relationship manager. Fully details can be found at: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/winchester/aspx/Home Return Date: 12.00 noon on the 27 May 2020

title: Highways England Stopped Vehicle Detection Framework
description:
Highways England is a Government company charged with operating, maintaining and improving England’s motorways and major A roads, including modernising and maintaining the highways in England. Highways England is procuring two framework agreements (in 2 lots) to provide a stopped vehicle detection (SVD) solution to detect individual stopped vehicles in live lanes on smart motorways all lane running sections of the Strategic Road Network (SRN) motorways in England. The SVD solution must enable early intervention and the setting of road signals that notify road users of the presence of the stopped vehicle. Lot 1 relates to the provision of a scanning radar solution as further described below. Lot 2 relates to the provision of technology solutions as further described below.
Highways England requires a Stopped Vehicle Detection (SVD) solution to detect stopped/stationary vehicles in live lanes on all lane running sections (ALR) of the Strategic Road Network (SRN) in England. The SVD solution must alert Highways England’s Regional Control Centres (RCC)/Regional Operations Centres (ROC) to the stopped/stationary vehicle. The technical requirements are provided in the service requirements at schedule 2 (service requirements and service provider service solution) of the framework agreementHighways England will procure a framework of two distinct lots for the procurement of a SVD solution. Each lot will require service provider capability to supply, support installation, complete commissioning and provide on-going warranty and supportThe framework will support Highways England’s objective to improve road user safety, further increasing customer confidence in smart motorways. This approach will support Highways England objectives to ensure the strategic road network is:• free-flowing;• safe and serviceable;• accessible and integrated.The framework agreement for lot 1 will be a single supplier agreement to provide a scanning radar solution:Lot 1 features:• immediate requirements for the supply and commissioning of a scanning radar solution on the Strategic Road Network (SRN) that meets Highways England Technical Requirements published with the OJEU Contract Notice;• the solution must have already been successfully tested on the SRN;• the service provider will need to ensure arrangements for production of units are in place immediately following framework award• production must commence on framework award, to facilitate immediate requirements of the Smart Motorway Alliance (SMA) delivery programme detailed in appendix A of framework agreement schedule 2 service requirementsCall-offs will be made in batches under this lot 1 to deliver scanning radar outstations to be installed across the all lane running network, in up to twenty 20 Sites, to contribute towards Highways England’s requirement for a SVD solution. The scanning radar outstations will be installed by a third party: the Smart Motorway Alliance (SMA), who will be the principal contractor for the installation works. Such installation works are not the subject of this procurement. The service provider will support installation, working with the smart motorway alliance, through on and off-site calibration, testing and training for the Highways England’s RCC/ROC operators and technology contractors. The solution must comply with the requirements set out in the tender documents, including Highways England Scanning Radar Stopped Vehicle Detection standard TR 2642.The service provider for lot 1 will need to ensure arrangements to ensure call-off of units can be met immediately following framework award.Anticipated sections of Smart Motorways incorporating SVD solutions are:M1 J39-42, M1 J32-35a, M1 J28-31, M20 J3-5, M23 J8-10, M3 J9-14, M27 J4-11, M4 J3-12, M6 J21a-26, M56 J6-8, M6 J16-19, M62 J18-20, M62 J10-12, M1 J23a-25, M6 J13-15, M1 J13-16, M6 J10a-13, M5 J4a-6, M1 J16-19, M6 J2-4Details relating to the services are made available within the tender documents that can be downloaded free of charge from the eSourcing portal BravoSolutions (https://highways.bravosolution.co.uk). Lot 2 covers requirements for technology solutions which can provide a stopped vehicle detection solution on the SRN, as further described below.• There is no cap on the number of tenderers which may be appointed to this lot provided their tender meets the evaluation requirements. Service providers with a successfully tested solution may participate in the mini-competitions for call-offs under lot 2.• To qualify for the framework, suppliers must demonstrate a solution that can be developed and tested by September 2021.• Highways England will facilitate testing of the solution on the SRN following framework award and it is a condition of participation in any mini-competition that the solution will have been successfully tested on the SRN. Framework award will take place in Summer/Autumn 2020.• Lot 2 will be for the procurement of successfully tested technology solution from September 2021 onwards.• Lot 2 will be for multi-suppliers and the estimated value is between GBP 7 m and GBP 14 m. This value is dependent on successful testing of alternative solutions within this lot.The solutions will be installed by a third party: the Smart Motorway Alliance (SMA), who will be the principal contractor for the installation works. Such installation works are not the subject of this procurement. The service provider will support installation, working with the smart motorway alliance, through on and off-site calibration, testing and training for the Highways England’s RCC/ROC operators and technology contractors. The system must comply with the requirements set out in the tender documents, including Highways England scanning radar stopped vehicle detection standard TR 2643.

title: Supply, Installation, Commissioning and Maintenance of a Triple Quadrupole LC/MS System
description:
Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust seeks offers for the supply, installation, commissioning and maintenance of a bench-top Triple Quadrupole LC/MS System for delivery and installation by 30 June 2020 or as soon as possible thereafter.
As described in clause II.1.4) above.

title: Supply and Delivery of Fresh and Frozen Meat and Poultry
description:
Provision of fresh and frozen meat and poultry for schools, etc.
Supply and delivery of fresh and frozen meat and poultry to schools, academies, free schools both existing and yet to be established, as well as other Council Premises, within the London Boroughs of Havering, Tower Hamlets, Greenwich, Camden, Hounslow, Enfield, Barking and Dagenham, Newham, Sutton and Thurrock Unitary Authority. The framework agreement will be available to all present and future members of Procurement Across London (PAL) group and to all London Councils listed on the website https://directory.londoncouncils.gov.uk/

title: Barking and Dagenham College — Advanced Engineering and Robotics Laboratory Equipment for Fundamentals, Emerging Technologies and Renewable Energies
description:
Barking and Dagenham College's newly formed Institute of Technology has a requirement for advanced engineering and robotics laboratory equipment for fundamentals, emerging technologies and renewable energies. Further information can be found within the Invitation to Tender document.
With respect to Guidance from the European Commission on using the public procurement framework in the emergency situation related to the Covid-19 crisis (2020/C 108 I/01) Barking and Dagenham College wishes to make use of the options and flexibilities available under the EU public procurement framework for the purchase of the supplies, services, and works on the basis of urgency.The College intends to procure complex advanced engineering systems for its Institute of Technology which must be fully operational for staff and students prior to the start of new academic year in August 2020 and crucial programme delivery.The College understands that the manufacturing process for our tender requirement is extensive and protracted; it is likely to involve oversees production and shipment. The known and considerable disruption to the production of goods and services throughout the world necessitates the urgency rationale and to utilise the option of accelerated timescales as per EU and UK Co

title: Remote Proctoring Solution (ITT)
description:
The British Council is seeking suppliers with the necessary capacity and capability to provide remote proctoring solutions. It is important to note that we will only be issuing the tender pack once suppliers have completed a Non-disclosure Agreement. Therefore, once you have registered an account please download the Non-Disclosure Agreement and return via the correspondence tab at the earliest opportunity. It is important that the NDAs are returned via correspondence, if they are submitted as a normal tender return document we will be unable to retrieve them. We are publishing this OJEU notice to allow suppliers the opportunity to complete the NDA prior to us publishing the tender. It is our current intention for the tender to be live Friday 17 April-Monday 4 May. If there is any change to this time frame we will update the OJEU notice and issue a message to all registered suppliers.
Remote proctoring solution.

title: Kings Gate Main Contract
description:
Cadw is the Welsh Government's historic environment service working for an accessible and well-protected historic environment for Wales. Cadw have a requirement for a qualified and experienced contractor to carry out the main works required for the Kings Gate project at Caernarfon Castle. Caernarfon Castle offers a complex logistical project due to the nature of working within a highly significant Castle infrastructure, whose sole purpose was to provide a defensive stronghold and in-turn be difficult to gain access to. Access is therefore limited. The main works briefly comprise of new visitor facilities within the Kings Gate Tower, to include a new café, toilet facilities, exhibition spaces, retail, external viewing decks and staff accommodation. The main focus of the project being to improve the visitor offer, especially for visitors with limited ability to access certain parts of the Castle. All bidders should be able familiar with working in an historic setting.
The works briefly comprise of new visitor facilities within the Kings Gate Tower at Caernarfon Castle, to include a new café, toilet facilities, exhibition spaces, retail, external viewing decks and staff accommodation.

title: A Contract Combined of Installation of Both Door Entry and Warden Call Systems and the Repair and Maintenance of Warden Call, Door Entry, Working at Heights and CCTV Systems
description:
We are intending to award a contract to a single contractor to perform the following in the Borough of Lewisham:• installation of door entry systems;• installation of warden call systems;• repair and maintenance of the following:— door entry systems,— warden call systems,— CCTV systems,— working at height systems.The contract will be for a primary term of 5 years with two optional 2 year extensions at the discretion of Lewisham Homes and subject to satisfactory performance of the contract and consistent achievement of our key performance indicators thus taking the contract to a maximum duration of 9 years. The contract will be governed by the JCT Measured Term 2016 contract and the Lewisham Homes Schedule of Amendments superseding these where applicable.
This procurement will be undertaken in accordance with the OJEU open one stage procedure. We will be awarding using a quality to price weighting of 60:40. We are looking to award to a single contractor and all further information will be contained within the procurement documentation.

title: Framework Agreement for Consultancy Services for Production Work
description:
The contracting authority will enter into a framework agreement with an intermediary (broker) of consultancy services for production work. Based on the requirement specification for each call-off/order, the consultant broker finds the most qualified consultants available in the market and offers them to the contracting authority. It will, thus, be the consultant broker´s job to assist the contracting authority by holding a competition in the market.
The contracting authority will enter into a framework agreement with an intermediary (broker) of consultancy services for production work. Based on the requirement specification for each call-off/order, the consultant broker finds the most qualified consultants available in the market and offers them to the contracting authority. It will, thus, be the consultant broker´s job to assist the contracting authority by holding a competition in the market.The objective of the contract is effective management of offers for consultants who can assist with assignments in the Norwegian Hydrographic Service production on request from the contracting authority. Assignments will be of varying scope and character. Consultants can only be ordered within the stated disciplines as described in the requirement specification.It is difficult for the contracting authority to give an estimate of the scope of this framework agreement, as the need is primarily related to external orders and funding through various projects. It is anticipated that there will be call-offs for two to four Consultants in 2020. NB: At the time of this announcement, this is unclear and is non-binding for the contracting authority. The contracting authority is awarded funds through the annual budget, and the scope may therefore vary from year to year.Further information about the objective and scope of the procurement is in the requirement specification.

title: Framework Agreement for Architectural and Consulting Engineering Services
description:
The service must cover the contracting authority's total need for technical consultancy services for municipal activities. The service must cover the contracting authority's ongoing need for expert consultancy services in the contract period.
The contract will be signed in accordance with NS 8402:2010 'General contract provisions for consultancy assignments remunerated according to hours worked', with the additions and changes that are specified and stated in the general contract provisions and the contract documents in this contract. The service must cover the contracting authority's total need for technical consultancy services for municipal activities. The service must cover the contracting authority's ongoing need for expert consultancy services in the contract period. The service includes all disciplines that are required in order to assist the contracting authority in the contract period. The service includes: buildings, property, roads, water and sewage, land use, and other technical consultancy services for municipal activities. The list is not exhaustive, but it illustrates the breadth of possible areas that are included in the service. The service covers different projects of a varying nature, size, cost, duration, and degree of difficulty in the contract period. Dates will be given for the individual services in the call-offs. The consultancy services will mainly be according to hours spent. The contracting authority will clarify the disciplines, services, scope, amounts and limits that are to be provided by the tenderer in each call-off. The tenderer must provide all of the disciplines stated in the price sheet. See the attached tender documentation for a detailed description of the service.

title: 1004910 New Government District, Contract H146 Hire of Specialist Adviser for Logistics
description: Statsbygg requests, for project number 1004910 New Government District, tenders for consultancy assignments for contract H146; the hire of specialist adviser for logistics. The hired specialist adviser shall develop a system for deliveries of mail and parcels, goods and services for the Government District and neighbouring areas during the operation stage. The adviser must assist the project manager of contract K302 Barracks and operation of the logistics during the construction stage.

title: Framework Agreement 8290 Consultant for Equipment and Building-related ICT — The Hospital Projects Aker and Gaustad
description:
The purpose of the procurement is to engage assistance for the implementation of planning and procurement of equipment and building-related ICT for hospital projects in Oslo.
The purpose of the procurement is to engage assistance for the implementation of planning and procurement of equipment and building-related ICT for hospital projects in Oslo. This concerns:— new hospital at Aker,— new hospital at Gaustad For equipment also includes the procurement of the projects at,— new clinic and proton building at the Radium Hospital,— regional security department.For the assignment, a framework agreement will be entered into with two to four supplier per lot, ref. chapter 9.The framework agreement duration is 2 years. The contracting authority will have an option to extend the framework agreement for a further 2 years, to a maximum of 4 years.Call-offs against the framework agreement must be expected throughout the entire agreement period. The call-offs may exceed the framework agreement period.

title: Patient Transport Services within and out of Krødsherad Municipality for Vestre Viken HF
description:
The contracting authority's enquiry concerns tenders for framework agreements for patient transport services for Vestre Viken HF [Vestre Viken Health Trust] within and out of Krødsherad Municipality.
Vestre Viken HF, hereafter called the contracting authority, invites tenderers to participate in an open tender contest in connection with the purchase of patient transport within and out of Krødsherad Municipality.See the attached tender documentation and specifications for further information.

title: Engineering Design Services Related to Reconstruction and Replacement of Lifts
description:
The municipal undertaking for social housing has approx. 130 lifts and lifting mechanisms related to the property portfolio. In order to ensure a stable and safe operation of these lifts, replacements and improvements are needed at a regular basis, and the municipal undertaking for social housing needs professional and technical assistance thereof. The purpose of the tender contest is to enter into a contract with two providers with expertise in lift engineering. The providers shall deliver advisory and consultative engineering services, construction management and condition assessment as well as consultancy and follow-up in related to other related tasks and services.
Boligbygg Oslo KF has approx. 130 lifts and lifting mechanisms connected with the property portfolio. In order to ensure a stable and safe operation of these lifts, replacements and improvements are needed at a regular basis, and the municipal undertaking for social housing needs professional and technical assistance thereof. The purpose of the tender contest is to enter into a contract with two providers with expertise in lift engineering. The providers shall deliver advisory and consultative engineering services, construction management and condition assessment as well as consultancy and follow-up in related to other related tasks and services.

title: 2020/32389 — Data Communication
description:
Innlandet County invites tenderers to a contest for a new contract for data communication. The aim of the procurement is to establish joint, secure and future-orientated infrastructure for data communication, with high availability and flexibility.
The procurement will cover communication between all locations in Innlandet County, as well as Stiftelsen Kunstbanken, Hedmark Arts Centre.The data communication must be provided as a service that will cover access to lines, including internet access, as well as the establishment and operation of them. The establishment will cover services such as the implementation of the required components (end equipment and software) in the infrastructure, configuration, testing and documentation.The service must be flexible and future-orientated and open for an expansion of functionality and capacity.Innlandet County currently has 53 locations in the Hedmark area and 45 locations in the Oppland area. The number of access points and locations can vary. The contract must allow a change in the number of lines and access points if required.

title: 20-031 Insurance Broker
description:
Vinmonopolet [the Norwegian Wine and Spirits Monopoly] will sign a contract for the following assignments/delivery: Insurance Broker.
The insurance broker service's content and deliveries will be responsible for the Norwegian Wine and Spirits Monopoly's insurances (insurance of persons and general insurance) being in accordance with out requirements. Consultancy services connected to insurance of persons and general insurance. Prepare overview of our insurances, deductibles and premiums. Assist with any damage settlement/replacement settlement. Implementation of the tender process in autumn 2020 by preparing tender documents and evaluating received tender offers.The Norwegian Wine and Spirits Monopoly is required by law to use SPK for pension insurance and the delivery therefore does not include this. Group life insurance is not included in this exception.Competence from tenderers:— contact person that is a personal insurance specialist,— contact person that is a general insurance specialist.NB: In the event of damage to alcoholic beverages, damaged goods are handled by the Norwegian Wine and Spirits Monopoly and not the insurance company.

title: Framework Agreement — Laundry and Dry Cleaning and Associated Services
description:
Agreement for laundry and dry cleaning with associated services throughout the country, with the exception of Troms and Finnmark and northern parts of Nordland.
The assignment comprises:— laundry, dry cleaning, impregnation and other treatment and finishing treatment of clothing, textile and commissariat materiel;— the hire of clothing;— sewing and small repairs;— handling and transporting materiel;— stock of goods.

title: Transport and Treatment of Timber from Isi Waste Facility
description:
Collection, transport and treatment of timber from Bærum kommune [Bærum municipality] at Isi waste facility.
The contracting authority will enter into a contract with a supplier for the transport and treatment of timber from Isi waste facility.There are staff at Isi waste facility providing guidance to the public when delivering waste. The staff also perform visual inspections of the waste, and remove objects that have been incorrectly placed, when discovered. The waste will be compacted at the recycling station.The waste composition and quantity during a year may vary somewhat, but such variations will not give a basis for changing price. There are minor seasonal variations in the quantity of waste. During 2019, approx. 6 044 tonne of timber was driven out. There was 1 In January and February there is a little less waste (approx. 2-3 containers per day), from March to June and August to October it is peak season (approx. 4-8 containers per day).All timber is loaded in 38 m3 hook containers by the contracting authority at Isi recycling station. The contracting authority has the containers. The percentage of filling/weight in the container can vary.The supplier will be responsible for all transport and treatment of timber from Isi recycling station, by order and need. The supplier will deliver containers back to the recycling station after emptying.All removal of timber will be recovered on a scale at Isi waste facility and invoicing will be in arrears or per month in accordance with the contracting authority's weigh journal. The weight journal from Isi must be enclosed with the invoice.

title: Framework Agreement for the Purchase of Sodium Nitrate Acid and the Collection of Ammonium Product
description: VEAS wants to enter into a framework agreement for ongoing delivery of sodium nitrate acid 62 % to tanks at VEAS, and collection of 55 % ammonium nitrate solution. title: Transport Media, Inoculating Loops and Petri Dishes for Delivery to the Western Norway Regional Health Authority
description:
The contracting authority requests tenders for transport media, inoculating loops and Petri dishes for use at microbiological departments.
The contracting authority requests tenders for transport media, inoculating loops and Petri dishes for use at microbiological departments.The delivery is divided into the following lots:1) inoculating loops,2) Petri dishes,3) feces collection tubes,4) pus collection swabs with Amies transport media,5) sampling media/transport media for molecular biological analyses (RNA and DNA).A framework agreement shall be entered for each of the above specified product groups.Tenders can be submitted for one or several product groups.The tenderer must complete the separate requirement specification and price sheet for each of the relevant product groups.

title: 19/11031 Lifting Platforms and Assistive Devices for Stairs
description:
The Norwegian Labour and Welfare Organisation, c/o NAV Finance and Management Department, the procurement section, hereafter called the contracting authority, invites tenderers to an open tender contest for the procurement of lifting platforms and assistive devices for stairs, stairlifts, stair climbers, and support systems in stairways, with the accompanying accessories, spare parts and services.The aim of the procurement is to establish an assortment of the necessary and appropriate lifting platforms and assistive devices for stairs for persons who, due to reduced mobility, need these aids. The contest will also include accessories, spare parts and services.The tender contest is divided into sub-contracts for the best possible coverage of the need for the relevant user groups, to ensure comparable products and contribute to having the desired product range. Contracts will be signed for each lot with a sufficient number of suppliers to cover the majority of the user´needs.
Lifting platforms in shafts with the accompanying accessories, spare parts and services.Contract type: a decision has not yet been made as to whether there will be parallel framework agreements or a contract with one tenderer.Only the tender letter must be submitted in lots 1-17 (cf. Part 1 Terms point 3.5).The tender letter and other documentation must be submitted in the lot 'Tender Submission'.The price is not the only contract award criterion. All other criteria are stated only in the tender documentation. Lifting platforms in half shafts with the accompanying accessories, spare parts and services.Contract type: a decision has not yet been made as to whether there will be parallel framework agreements or a contract with one tenderer.Only the tender letter must be submitted in lots 1-17 (cf. Part 1 Terms point 3.5).The tender letter and other documentation must be submitted in the lot 'Tender Submission'.The price is not the only contract award criterion. All other criteria are stated only in the tender documentation. Lifting platforms with integrated stairs, with the accompanying accessories, spare parts and services.Contract type: a decision has not yet been made as to whether there will be parallel framework agreements or a contract with one tenderer.Only the tender letter must be submitted in lots 1-17 (cf. Part 1 Terms point 3.5).The tender letter and other documentation must be submitted in the lot 'Tender Submission'.The price is not the only contract award criterion. All other criteria are stated only in the tender documentation. Lifting platforms, vertical lifting and with little space demanding parking, with the accompanying accessories, spare parts and services.Contract type: a decision has not yet been made as to whether there will be parallel framework agreements or a contract with one tenderer.Only the tender letter must be submitted in lots 1-17 (cf. Part 1 Terms point 3.5).The tender letter and other documentation must be submitted in the lot 'Tender Submission'.The price is not the only contract award criterion. All other criteria are stated only in the tender documentation. Lifting platform with a lifting height up to and including 50 cm, with the accompanying accessories, spare parts and services.Contract type: a decision has not yet been made as to whether there will be parallel framework agreements or a contract with one tenderer.Only the tender letter must be submitted in lots 1-17 (cf. Part 1 Terms point 3.5).The tender letter and other documentation must be submitted in the lot 'Tender Submission'.The price is not the only contract award criterion. All other criteria are stated only in the tender documentation. Lifting platform with a lifting height from 50 cm up to and including 100 cm, with the accompanying accessories, spare parts and services.Contract type: a decision has not yet been made as to whether there will be parallel framework agreements or a contract with one tenderer.Only the tender letter must be submitted in lots 1-17 (cf. Part 1 Terms point 3.5).The tender letter and other documentation must be submitted in the lot 'Tender Submission'.The price is not the only contract award criterion. All other criteria are stated only in the tender documentation. Lifting platform with a lifting height from 100 cm up to and including 300 cm, with the accompanying accessories, spare parts and services.Contract type: a decision has not yet been made as to whether there will be parallel framework agreements or a contract with one tenderer.Only the tender letter must be submitted in lots 1-17 (cf. Part 1 Terms point 3.5).The tender letter and other documentation must be submitted in the lot 'Tender Submission'.The price is not the only contract award criterion. All other criteria are stated only in the tender documentation. Stairlifts with a seat for straight stairs — indoor use, with the accompanying accessories, spare parts and services.Contract type: a decision has not yet been made as to whether there will be parallel framework agreements or a contract with one tenderer.Only the tender letter must be submitted in lots 1-17 (cf. Part 1 Terms point 3.5).The tender letter and other documentation must be submitted in the lot 'Tender Submission'.The price is not the only contract award criterion. All other criteria are stated only in the tender documentation. Stairlifts with a seat for straight stairs — outdoor use, with the accompanying accessories, spare parts and services.Contract type: a decision has not yet been made as to whether there will be parallel framework agreements or a contract with one tenderer.Only the tender letter must be submitted in lots 1-17 (cf. and Welfare Organisation, c/o NAV Finance and Management Department, the procurement section, hereafter called the contracting authority, invites tenderers to an open tender contest for the procurement of lifting platforms and assistive devices for stairs, stairlifts, stair climbers, and support systems in stairways, with the accompanying accessories, spare parts and services.The aim of the procurement is to establish an assortment of the necessary and appropriate lifting platforms and assistive devices for stairs for persons who, due to reduced mobility, need these aids. The contest will also include accessories, spare parts and services.The tender contest is divided into sub-contracts for the best possible coverage of the need for the relevant user groups, to ensure comparable products and contribute to having the desired product range. Contracts will be signed for each lot with a sufficient number of suppliers to cover the majority of the user´needs.

title: Execution Contract — County Road 44 Bus Road for the Section Diagonalen — Gausel Station
description:
Execution contract — County road 44 Bus road for the section Diagonalen — Gausel station includes the construction of a public-transport lane and the expansion of County road 44. The section is 1 300 metres. The project for the construction County road 44 also includes to a large extent the establishment of dry walls, concrete walls cast on site, noise reduction walls and two new culverts.The framework agreement has an estimated value of NOK 350 000 000 excluding VAT.Please note that an addendum to the tender documents will be published. See annex ‘varsel om kommende addendum’ (‘notification of pending addendum’). As soon as this addendum is published, the registered tenderers will receive a notification thereof by email.
Execution contract — County road 44 Bus road for the section Diagonalen — Gausel station includes the construction of a public-transport lane and the expansion of County road 44. The section is 1 300 metres. title: 2020-31 KON Broadband Development, Møre og Romsdal
description:
Møre og Romsdal County is responsible for ensuring that broadband development with public support in 10 municipalities is announced as a joint contest, in accordance with the public procurement regulations and the government support rules.The notice has therefore Møre og Romsdal County as the contracting authority, but it will be each individual municipalities, cf. point 1.2.1 in the tender documentation, that will be the contract party and responsible for their subproject.The county is responsible for ensuring that the development of the 11 subprojects is announced as a joint contest, in accordance with the public procurement regulations and government support rules. Tenderers can submit tenders for one or more of the subprojects.The contract is subject to approval and financing the costs in each municipal council and that the tender is within the resources that have been set aside for the project. If there is limited financing, the contracting authority for each subproject is fee to cancel the contest.
See the tender documents and Annexes.Additional information:The contracting authority uses electronic procurement processes via the system provider Mercell (www.mercell.no). Amongst other things, tenders must be submitted electronically by the stated tender deadline.Tenderers are responsible for submitting tenders by the tender deadline.It is therefore recommended that the tender is submitted well in advance of the deadline, e.g. at least 1 hour before the tender deadline expires. See the tender documents and annexes.Additional information:The contracting authority uses electronic procurement processes via the system provider Mercell (www.mercell.no). Amongst other things, tenders must be submitted electronically by the stated tender deadline.Tenderers are responsible for submitting tenders by the tender deadline.It is therefore recommended that the tender is submitted well in advance of the deadline, e.g. at least 1 hour before the tender deadline expires.

title: Property Feasibility Team Services
description:
An Post is seeking applications from suitably qualified and experienced companies for appointment to a multi-party framework agreement for property feasibility team services. The framework shall be divided into five (5) lots:Lot 1: Project Manager, Urban Planning and Transport Planning,Lot 2: Architect,Lot 3: Property Valuer,Lot 4: Quantity Surveyor,Lot 5: Civil and Structural Engineer.During the term of the framework these services will form part of a multi-disciplinary property feasibility team and it is envisaged that the team will assess existing and potential An Post property assets and provide guidance on how these assets can be optimised going forward from a planning perspective.The feasibility team will also be required to consider and advise on lands that could be used to establish future An Post properties including distribution centres and retails stores.Applicants must be in a position to provide both elements of the services set out above.
Lot 1: Property manager, urban planning and transport planningProject management — lead the feasibility team in preparation of feasibility reports; tracking of ongoing projects; organisation of meetings and account management.Urban planning — preparation of site feasibility reports; preparation of planning submissions and appeals; preparation of submissions on statutory (e.g. Development Plans) and non-statutory (Masterplans) plans and documents; preparation of due diligence reports; monitoring and review of planning applications; general planning advice on a case by case basis.Transport planning — preparation of feasibility studies and drawings; strategic transport advice; review of planning applications; general advice from a transport perspective on a case by case basis. Lot 2: ArchitectArchitecture — preparation of feasibility plans with advice from planning and property team for both the optimisation of existing and proposed retail offices and lands and the optimisation of both existing and new mails and parcels units within the An Post Business. This will include preparation of feasibility plans for use by property valuation for analysis and for costing by quantity surveyor. It also includes general architectural advice on a case by case basis. Attendance at ongoing feasibility meetings. Lot 3: Property valuerProperty valuation and redevelopment advice — advise on preferred end uses for feasibility plans with advice from planning and property team for both the optimisation of existing and proposed retail offices and lands and the optimisation of both existing and new mails and parcels units within the An Post Business. This will include preparation of valuations of existing and proposed redevelopments within portfolio, market and industry knowledge, residual redevelopment property valuations and analysis. It also includes provision of advice as to timing to market, case-by-case market knowledge of specific areas, working current knowledge of market comparables, etc. General advice on a case by case basis. Attendance at ongoing feasibility meetings. Lot 4: Quantity surveyorQuantity surveyor — with proven market knowledge of current tender levels this role is to advise on end costs for feasibility plans. Working within a feasibility team for both the optimisation of existing and proposed retail offices and lands and the optimisation of both existing and new mails and parcels units within the An Post Business. This will include preparation of bills of quantities/quantum of costs of proposed redevelopments within portfolio. General costing advice on a case by case basis. Attendance at ongoing feasibility meetings. Lot 5: Civil and structural engineerEngineering — involvement in preparation of feasibility plans giving advice on matters civil and structural for both the optimisation of existing and proposed retail offices and lands and the optimisation of both existing and new mails and parcels facilities within the An Post Business. This will include informing detailed feasibility plan design and costing in all matters relating to civil and structural engineering on a site specific basis. Attendance at ongoing feasibility meetings.
